abstract: Sanford C. Bernstein said A.I.G.’s property and casualty business has an $11.9 billion shortfall in reserves to pay claims.
snippet: Sanford C. Bernstein said A.I.G.’s property and casualty business has an $11.9 billion shortfall in reserves to pay claims.
lead_paragraph: An independent analysis of whether the insurance industry has been setting aside enough money to pay its claims estimates that the American International Group has a shortfall of $11.9 billion in its property and casualty business.

headline.main: Report Cites Big Shortfall in Reserves at A.I.G.
headline.print_headline: Report Cites Big Shortfall In Reserves At A.I.G.
